custom_fields.key_topics: This course is designed to further familiarize students with the cultures and perspectives of the Spanish-speaking world.
custom_fields.prerequisite_knowledge:
82-241 or placement.
Writing, reading, listening and speaking abilities above the elementary level in Spanish, as determined by placing test. A student with prior experience in Spanish must take the placement exam.
custom_fields.assessment_structure: Assignments, exams, final, presentation, project, etc? Written and oral quizzes and exams, assignments, final project and presentation, final exam.
custom_fields.goals: Students will develop selfexpression across a range of culturally significant topics, frequently working in groups and pairs, and utilizing technologies that enhance learning opportunities and promote skill development. The course provides extracurricular opportunities to interact with members of the Spanishspeaking community.
custom_fields.relevance:
Dietrich GenEd Prior to Fall 2021: Communicating
Dietrich GenEd After Fall 2021: Intercultural and Global Inquiry

Students will develop self-expression across a range of culturally significant topics, improving their speaking, listening, reading, and writing skills while working with longer passages of language in context through reading, writing and listening/viewing (e.g. tv series, movies, short novels, plays)
custom_fields.learning_resources: The textbook (available in hard copy and digital editions) includes an online component featuring interactive resources (audio, video, etc.). Additional resources are shared via CANVAS.
custom_fields.extra_time_commitment: 3 hours of in-class instruction per week are required. Students are expected to complete 2 hours of work per class hour. Some of the assignments involve brief meetings with assistants or occasionally attending events.

long_desc: Intermediate Spanish II is the second part of a twosemester course sequence 82241, 82242 designed to familiarize students with the cultures and perspectives of the Spanishspeaking world. Students will develop selfexpression across a range of culturally significant topics, improving their speaking, listening, reading, and writing skills while working with longer passages of language in context through reading, writing and listeningviewing e.g. tv series, movies, short novels, plays and frequently working in groups and pairs, and utilizing technologies that enhance learning opportunities and promote skill development. The course provides extracurricular opportunities to interact with members of the Spanishspeaking community.

prereqs.text: (82-241 at least D) or (82-243 at least D)

name: Intermediate Spanish II
